review_title: A lot of work little pay
pros: The patients No support from management Staff childish

pros: In a program of all inclusive care (PACE), the pressures of having to meet productivity is not existent because the focus is on quality of care. The department of therapy workers is phenomenal with caring individuals who work hard to service seniors. The bandwidth of what you can do as a physical therapist is endless with the support of a great leader in the rehabilitation department. Creativity within the department is encouraged. The organizational style is laid back, which makes the environment feel humbling.
cons: Leadership lacks the ability to lead. Communication from leadership to the colleagues is poor. There is lack of vision for the organization given there it has been difficult with multiple openings and re-openings due to COVID-19 and loss of staffing through the process. One person is permitted to cover multiple roles which leads to poor quality coverage of the roles.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Langhorne, PA
pros: Nursing staff are caring, strong patient advocates for the best possible outcomes of their patients they serve.
cons: The highly political atmosphere of power from administration. They do not like to listen to front line nurses for positive change.
